channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+1905] The Dark Side of Vitaminwater
item.description: In a staggering feat of twisted logic, Coca-Cola is defending the lawsuit by asserting that "no consumer could reasonably be misled into thinking vitaminwater was a healthy beverage." does it mean that it's okay for a corporation to lie about its products, as long as they can then turn around and claim that no one actually believes their lies?

item.title: [+1388] If Facebook, YouTube and Skype were advertised in the 1960's
[+1132] Cancelled Ubisoft game will blow your mind off
item.description: Why do good games always get canned?

item.title: [+1035] Watch: David Letterman Curses Out Andrew Breitbart, Fox News
item.description: Last night, David Letterman welcomed Rachel Maddow to the Late Show and—while discussing Shirley Sherrod/Andrew Breitbart—got uncharacteristically political, asking, "How much time was wasted by this asshole fucking around?" Shots were fired at Fox News, too. Video inside.

item.title: [+993] This is What Will Destroy The New Digg
item.description: I might get banned for saying this, but honestly I think this is what will destroy the new Digg -- Indie publishers are going to get screwed and Lamestream Media will dominate even more than it does already.

item.title: [+973] Why California's Prop 8 Against Gay Marriage Was Struck Down
item.description: With an encyclopedic decision, a U.S. federal judge declares California's anti-single sex marriage ban unconstitutional, setting up legal battles further up the appellate chain

item.title: [+783] Bush Pushes Back Memoirs So GOP Isn't Hurt In Midterms
item.description: George W. Bush pushed back publication of his memoirs, "Decision Points," out of fear that a public reminder of his presidential legacy would hurt Republicans heading into November's midterm elections, Bush's friends tell the Financial Times. The FT reports that Bush refused to allow publication in September, which would have been a better....

item.title: [+778] The Internet World (Map)
item.description: As a tribute to XKCD’s ‘Map of Online Communities’, we have decided to re-create our own, updated version of this map. The numbers are taken to reflect many new developments in the social networking communities, including Facebook surpassing Myspace as the preeminent online community...

item.title: [+767] Law Bans Marriages Between People Who Don't Love Each Other
[+726] How to fold paper in half - 12 times
item.description: I told my son that I would give him a million dollars if he could fold a piece of paper in half, and in half again, and so on for a total of 10 times. Of course he tried, and of course he failed. I knew that this would happen, because it was "Accepted Wisdom" that it was impossible to fold a piece of paper in half 10 times. Now I know I was wrong.

item.title: [+679] Space: The Final Frontier (Pic)
[+642] "Show Me Boobs or Jail" Says Cop -> She Does -> He's Fired
item.description: "A Provo police officer is accused of groping a woman after saying he would arrest her if she did not show him her breasts." - Note: Absence of Boobs In Article. Please advise.

item.title: [+605] Wild Foxes Jumping on a Trampoline [VIDEO]
[+602] This It How It Feels to Be Under a Nuclear Attack
item.description: We're used to see atomic bombs images. From afar, they even look beautiful. But when one explodes near you, that immaculate light will burn your skin and make you bleed spontaneously. 65 years ago today, this is how that felt....

item.title: [+541] Tila Tequila Starring In Porn Film
item.description: Tila Tequila can officially add porn star to her resume. The Internet entrepreneur is starring in an XXX-rated film that will have a major distributor.

item.title: [+536] Guess The Quote: Bin Laden or Newt Gingrich?
item.description: "Everything Bin Laden says about the U.S., Gingrich validates. All you have to do is read their statements, side by side."

item.title: [+477] The Top Ten RPGs of All Time
item.description: ​Breaking down the greatest role-playing games of all time is a tricky task. There are many games that have RPG characteristics, but don't really fall into the genre. There are some franchises that constantly put out great products, and it is difficult to separate one from the rest.

item.title: [+474] New Haircut? [Comic]
[+466] Librarian Fired for Refusing to Reveal Her Weight
item.description: Bureacracy at its finest! Lisa Bonifas, a city library circulation clerk in Urbandale, Iowa, was fired for refusing to reveal her weight. Why was the city asking in the first place? It's printing the information on new city ID cards.

item.title: [+461] Mom Suing After Wet T-Shirt Leads to Arrest
item.description: A central Florida woman who was arrested after her shirt got wet at a kiddie splash park in Tavares is suing the city for violating her rights.
